ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course was an excellent introduction to German. I came into the course knowing absolutely nothing, and left being able to pick up sentences in movies and grasp the general thrust of news articles. The curriculum moves quickly, but not in any overwhelmingly so: if one resolves to make a daily practice, then it's quite manageable, as far as language courses go.
I learned conversational German - speaking, reading, writing, and listening. We also learned about various aspects of culture in German-speaking countries

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Varied teaching methodology, with formal grammar and word accusation being paired with engaging exercises (like film, short stories, etc). Teachers across all sections seem to be very available for office hours, and Department holds multiple supplementary sessions each week. 

Weaknesses: Particularly for some of the grammar, would have benefitted from review worksheets with repetitive pattern recognition.

Some of the asynchronous work assignments were really helpful - the Nico's Weg movie was the best language-learning movie I have used, and the videos about various things like dorm life and the importance of being ecologically friendly were interesting. Some were not the most helpful (the chocolate song). To that end, more German music would be great for listening practice and being more familiar with cultural references we might encounter in Germany/Austria/Switzerland.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Would highly recommend the course for those with a genuine interest in studying German. Our section skewed heavily towards graduate students / serious undergraduates, which helped facilitate a truly engaged learning environment.
